member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.QuoteAsmSvcContract.CheckPrePartInfo(System.String@,System.String,System.Guid,System.String@,System.Boolean@,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: The method is to be run on leave of the PartNum, Revision fields before the GetPartInfo or Update methods are run. This returns all the questions that need to be asked before a part can be changed.
member.param: The new PartNum if a substitute part is found, partNum will be the substitute part
The table that caused this method to be called
sys row DI of the source table - this is needed for the product configurator logic
Asks if the user wants to use a substitute part
Indicates other substitute parts besides the default exist

Type of message returned. Values can be; "Question" (asking if they want to use the substitute part) "Warning" (Warns them that a part is onhold or runout). "Error" (Part in Inactive, or Onhold/Runout parts are not accepted in this case) . "Question" is asking if they want to use the substitute part.
contains any messages related to the configurator

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.Company
member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.QuoteNum
member.summary: Quote number to which this line item detail record is associated with. This is part of the foreign key to OrderHed file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.QuoteLine
member.summary: The QuoteLine that record is related to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: The AssemblySeq number of the related QuoteAsm record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.MtlSeq
member.summary: A sequence number that uniquely defines the Material record within a specific Quote/Line/Assembly. System assigned using the next available number, determined by reading last QuoteMtl record on the Quote/Line/Assembly and then adding one to it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number of required material. Does not have to be valid in Part master file, but must not be blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.Description
member.summary: Description of the material. Cannot be blank

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.QtyPer
member.summary: Quantity required per one of the Parent item. This is a factor used in calculating the total material requirement.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.IUM
member.summary: The issue/usage unit of measure for this material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.Direct
member.summary: Indicates if this material requirement is going to be satisfied by another job (possibly in another Site), as opposed to a warehouse.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.LeadTime
member.summary: Expected Purchasing lead time (in days) for the material. This is passed along to the job if the item gets manufactured.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.RelatedOperation
member.summary: A material record can be related to a specific operation. This field contains the QuoteOpr.OprSeq of the operation that it is related to. It can be left as zero meaning that this material is required at the very beginning of the production job.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.SalvagePartNum
member.summary: Part number for Salvaged scrap from this material record. An optional field. This does not have to be valid in the Part master. Salvage info is mainly to allow the credit back to a job for this type of scrap via Salvage receipt process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.SalvageDescription
member.summary: Description of Salvaged material. Use Part.Description for a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.SalvageQtyPer
member.summary: A factor that multiplied by the RequiredQty for the material results in the expected total salvage quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.SalvageUM
member.summary: Default Unit of measure for the Salvaged Part. Default from the Part.IUM.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.SalvageUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated Salvage Unit Credit. Use the appropriate cost from the Part master as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.SalvageMtlBurRate
member.summary: The salvage material burden rate for this Quote Material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.SalvageEstMtlBurUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated salvage Mtl Burden Unit Credit. May be defaulted from the appropriate Part master cost fields. Quoting allows multiple unit costs to be entered for quantity price breaks via PBQty & PBCost arrays. The price break logic considers the EstUnitCost field as the lowest element in the price break structure. That is if you had price breaks for quantities of 100, 500 and 1000. Then the EstUnitCost would represent the cost if the required qty is 1 - 99.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.MfgComment
member.summary: Comments for manufacturing about this material record. These comments are printed on manufacturing reports, such as the router. For valid Parts use the Part.MfgComment as a default. View as Editor widget.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.VendorNum
member.summary: Used to identify a default vendor. Use the Part.VendorNum as a default. This will be used as a default for purchasing and miscellaneous receipts. This field is not directly maintainable; instead it's assigned by having the user either entering the "VendorID" and then finding the VendorNum in the Vendor file or by selection list processing. An optional field, but if entered must be valid.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.PurPoint
member.summary: The Vendors purchase point ID. Along with the VendorNum is used to tie back to the VendorPP master file. Use the default Purchase point defined in the Vendor file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.BuyIt
member.summary: Indicates if this material is to be Purchased for the Job. If this is a non inventory part then this is "Yes" and can't be changed. If this is a valid Part then set it to "NO" but the user can override it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.PurComment
member.summary:
Comments for purchasing about this material record on this job. These comments will be used as defaults to the PODetail.Comment field when the purchase order references this JobMtl record.
View as Editor widget.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.MinimumCost
member.summary: Minimum Cost that will be used for this material. That is if the system will take the greater of (required quantity * unit cost) or (MinimumCost) when calculating the material cost for the quote.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.EstUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Unit Cost. May be defaulted from the appropriate Part master cost fields. Quoting allows multiple unit costs to be entered for quantity price breaks via PBQty & PBCost arrays. The price break logic considers the EstUnitCost field as the lowest element in the price break structure. That is if you had price breaks for quantities of 100, 500 and 1000. Then the EstUnitCost would represent the cost if the required qty is 1 - 99.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.MtlBurRate
member.summary: The material burden rate for this Quote Material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.EstMtlBurUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Mtl Burden Unit Cost. May be defaulted from the appropriate Part master cost fields. Quoting allows multiple unit costs to be entered for quantity price breaks via PBQty & PBCost arrays. The price break logic considers the EstUnitCost field as the lowest element in the price break structure. That is if you had price breaks for quantities of 100, 500 and 1000. Then the EstUnitCost would represent the cost if the required qty is 1 - 99.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.RequiredQty
member.summary: Required Qty per ONE of the END ITEM. This is a system calculated field. Calculated as (Parent Required Qty X QtyPer). The parent qty is one if assemblySeq zero else (QuoteAsmbl.RequireQty) if AssemblySeq > 0.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.EstScrap
member.summary: Estimated Scrap (fallout) that is expected to occur for this material. The scrap increase the Required quantity. Example; need 1000 pieces scrap of 10 % will show a required quantity of 1100.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.EstScrapType
member.summary: Qualifies the ScrapQty entry as being a fixed quantity or a percentage of run quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.FixedQty
member.summary: Indicates if the QtyPer field represents a "Fixed Quantity". If Yes, then the required quantity = QtyPer. That is, the quantity does not change as the number of pieces being produced changes. This can be used to enter Tooling or Fixture type of requirements.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.FindNum
member.summary: Characters used on the drawing to show where material is used.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.Class
member.summary: The Inventory class that this Part belongs to. The Class field can be blank or must be valid in the PartClass master file. CLasses could be set up for different type of raw materials. It will primarily be used as a report selection parameter.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.APSAddResType
member.summary: Advanced Planning and Scheduling Additional Resource Type. Indicates whether the Part should be treated as an AdditionalResourceType by eScheduler. 'I' to ignore in eScheduler 'M' to treat at Material in eScheduler 'A' to treat as AddResType in eScheduler

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtMtlAppRow.PBrkQty01
member.summary: Price break quantity, quantity at which a price break occurs. The quantity represent the minimum qty that is needed to obtain the corresponding price established in PBCost array. Not all 4 elements need to be entered. However they must be entered consecutively in ascending order. Quoting selects the material unit cost to use by first calculating the material Required Qty based on the quote quantity. Then searches the PBQty array finding the element which is less than and closest to the required qty. If one is found then the corresponding PBCost is used else EstUnitCost is used.

member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.QuoteNum
member.summary: Quote number to which this line item detail record is associated with. This is part of the foreign key to OrderHed file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.QuoteLine
member.summary: The QuoteLine that record is related to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: The AssemblySeq number of the related QuoteAsm record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.OprSeq
member.summary: A sequence number which uniquely identifies the operation record within the Quote/Line/Assembly. The sequence can be system generated or assigned by user. System generated numbers are determined by reading last QuoteOpr for the QuoteLine/Asm and then figures out what the next number that is divisible by 10. If this number is within 3 of the last Number on file it will be bumped up another 10. This keeps a minimum of 2 available sequences between records. For example if last = 18 Next would be 30, If last = 17 next = 20.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.OpCode
member.summary: Operation Master Code - Links the QuoteOpr record with a OpMaster record. Default is given from WrkCenter.OpCode. Must be valid in the OpMaster file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.OpStdID
member.summary:
The Operation standard ID. This links the JobOPer to the OpStd master file. This can be blank or if entered must be valid if entered. When this field is changed the ProdStandard, StdFormat and StdBasis should be refreshed with the new defaults.
Valid for "inside operations" only.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.EstSetHours
member.summary: The TOTAL estimated set up hours FOR ALL MACHINES. This can be zero only if the ProdStandard is greater than zero. Default from OpStd.SetupHours * Machines.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.ProdStandard
member.summary:
The production standard for the operation. It can be expressed as Hours, Minutes per piece, Pieces per Time, Operations per Minute or Operations per hour. This along with the StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPer and fields are used to calculate the operations estimated production hours. A value can be defaulted from the OpStd master.
NOTE: The ProdStandard can only be zero if the EstSetHours are greater than zero.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.StdFormat
member.summary:
Qualifier for the Production Standard field. The valid qualifiers are:
"HP" - Hours/Piece, "MP" - Minutes/Piece, "PH" - Pieces/Hour,
"PM" - Pieces/Minute, "OH" - Operations/Hour,
"OM" - Operations/Minute, HR - Fixed Hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.StdBasis
member.summary:
A standard basis is to be used to with standards that are time per piece (HP & MP). The basis is a Divisor to the number of pieces. Valid codes are E-Eaches, C=100's, M=1000's, T=10,000.
This field is used in the formula for calculating the estimated production hours. The operation quantity is divided by the basis value and then multiplied by the standard to result in hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.OpsPerPart
member.summary: Number of operations per part. This is used in the calculation of the estimated production hours when the StdFormat is "OM" or "OH". This should not be accessible if StdFormat is not "OM" or "OH". It MUST BE > 0 if StdFormat is "OM" or "OH".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.QtyPer
member.summary: Production Quantity per one of the Parent Item.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.ProdLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for estimated production labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.QProdLRate if not zero, else OpMaster.ProdLRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.SetupLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate for estimated setup labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.QSetupLRate if not zero, else OpMaster.SetupLabRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.ProdBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the production time on this operation. (EstProdHrs X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.QProdBurRate if not zero, else WrkCenter.ProdBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.SetupBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the Setup time on this operation. (EstSetHours X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.QSetUpBurRate if not zero, else WrkCenter.SetupBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.Machines
member.summary: Defaulted from the WrkCenter.SchMachines field. This is the number of machines that this operation will run on at the same time. Logically thought of as a "Squeeze factor" to scheduling. That is, the more machines the shorter the schedule. This affects how much of the total daily workcenter capacity that the operation will consume. For example; Center has 4 machines, 8 Hours per day and operation 2 machines. This operation would consume 16 hours of capacity per day. So if it had 32 hours of estimated production it would schedule as taking 2 days. NOTE THIS ONLY APPLIES TO PRODUCTION HOURS, NOT SETUP. The stored setup hours is a total for all machines. This stored number is divided by the number of machines when it is displayed on the screen during operation maintenance.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.SetUpCrewSize
member.summary: Defaulted from the WrkCenter.SetUpCrewSize field. It's the number of people it physically takes to set up this operation. It is used as a multiplier in the estimated labor hours calculation. JobOper.EstSetHours * JobOper.SetUpCrewSize = Estimated Labor hours for the operation. This also affects the estimated labor cost. Est Cost = Est Labor Hours * SetUpLaborRate

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.ProdCrewSize
member.summary: Defaults from the WrkCenter.ProdCrewSize. The number of people it physically takes to perform the production on this operation per machine that it is run on. CrewSize * JobOper.EstProdHours = Est. Prod. Labor Hours. Note this can be a fraction for operations that do not require full time attention of an employee. See also SetUpCrewSize.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.EstScrap
member.summary: Estimated Scrap (fallout) that is expected to occur on this operation. The scrap increase the Run quantity. Example; need 1000 pieces scrap of 10 % will show a operation run quantity of 1100.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.EstScrapType
member.summary: Qualifies the ScrapQty entry as being a fixed quantity or a percentage of run quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.SubContract
member.summary: This flags the operation as being a "SubContract" or an "Internal" operation. This also controls what fields are allowed to be updated for this record. For example, an internal operation will not have a PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.IUM
member.summary: Issue Unit of Measure. Applicable only when SubContract = Yes

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.DaysOut
member.summary: Hours required is calculated as days * 8. Only Applicable when SubContract = Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.PartNum
member.summary: The PartNum to be shipped to the subcontract. Applicable only when SubContract = Yes. Default the QuoteDtl.PartNum or QuoteAsm.PartNum depending on the QuoteOpr.AssemblySeq.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.Description
member.summary: Description of item to be sent to subcontractor.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.VendorNum
member.summary: The SubContractors VendorNum that ties back to the Vendor master file. This is only valid for "SubContract" operations. This field is not directly maintainable, instead its assigned by having the user either enter the "VendorID" and then finding the VendorNum in the Vendor file or by selection list processing. This is a mandatory entry for subcontract operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.PurPoint
member.summary: The Vendors purchase point ID. This field is only for the "Subcontract" operations. Along with the VendorNum is used to tie back to the VendorPP master file. Use the default Purchase point defined in the Vendor file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.CommentText
member.summary: Editor widget for quote operation comments.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.SchedRelation
member.summary: Indicates the scheduling relationship between this and the preceding operation. Possible values are "SS" - Start to Start, "FS" Finish to Start or "FF" Finish to Finish. A "SS" can start when the preceding operation starts. A "FS" starts when the preceding operation is finished. A "FF" can finish when the preceding operation finishes. These relationships do not span between levels of assemblies. The first operation on an assembly is always treated as being "FS" relationship. A "FF" finishes when the preceding operation is finished.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.MinimumCost
member.summary: Minimum Cost that will be used for subcontract costs. That is if the system will take the greater of (required quantity * unit cost) or (MinimumCost) when calculating the subcontract cost for the quote.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.EstUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Unit Cost. May be defaulted from the appropriate Part master cost fields. Quoting allows multiple unit costs to be entered for quantity price breaks via PBQty & PBCost arrays. The price break logic considers the EstUnitCost field as the lowest element in the price break structure. That is if you had price breaks for quantities of 100, 500 and 1000. Then the EstUnitCost would represent the cost if the required qty is 1 - 99.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.AddlSetupHours
member.summary: Additional Setup Hours that will be required after a certain quantity has been run for this operation. The quantity at which this occurs is established in AddSetupQty field. The system determines the setup hours as SetupHrs + (Max((RunQty - AddlSetupQty,0))/AddlSetUpQty) * AddlSetupHours. Any fractional results of the AddlSetUpQty calcs are rounded up to the next whole number before multiplying by the AddlSetUpHours..

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.AddlSetUpQty
member.summary: Additional Setup quantity indicates the quantity at which additional setup time will be incurred.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.RunQty
member.summary: The total operation quantity per ONE of the End Part. This is a system calculated field. Calculated as (Assembly Required Qty X QtyPer). This does not include scrap quantity. The scrap will be determined as each quoting quantity is applied towards the operation during the cost calculations. The assembly qty is either the One if QuoteOpr.AssemblySeq = 0 or (QuoteAsm.RequireQty) if QuoteOpr.AssemblySeq > 0. This value is refreshed when maintenance is performed on the operation record or an assemblies production qty is changed

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.MiscAmt
member.summary: A total additional charge that is incurred when purchasing this service. Ex(Lot,Setup,Handling,etc...). Defaulted from VendPart.MiscAmt. This is NOT part of the a Unit Cost. It is NOT consider in the logic of using Minimum Cost.

member.summary: Used for scheduling a quote. This date is only valid for the quantity and date the user entered for Quote Scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.WIQueStartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling, and it only valid for the Date/Quantity the user entered in quote scheduling.

member.summary: Indicates the Method for Labor Entry. Can be "T" - Time and Quantity, "Q" - Quantity Only (Time is estimated) or "B" - Backflush.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.PrimarySetupOpDtl
member.summary: Identifies the primary QuoteOpDtl to be used for setup. The setup time for the operation is determined on the QuoteOpDtl. If <> 0, must identify a valid QuoteOpDtl. The QuoteOpDtl needs to have a RequiredFor = S or B.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.PrimaryProdOpDtl
member.summary: Identifies the primary QuoteOpDtl to be used for production. The production run time for the operation is determined on the QuoteOpDtl. If <> 0, must identify a valid QuoteOpDtl. The QuoteOpDtl needs to have a RequiredFor = P or B.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.BrkQty07
member.summary: Price break/production break quantity, quantity at which a price break occurs for subcontracting or a production break occurs for internal operations. The quantity represents the minimum qty that is needed to obtain the corresponding price/standard established in PBCost or PBStdRate arrays. Not all 5 elements need to be entered. However they must be entered consecutively in ascending order. Quoting selects the unit cost/Standard to use by first calculating the Required Qty based on the quote quantity. Then searches the BreakQty array finding the element which is less than and closest to the required qty. If one is found then the corresponding PBCost/PBStdRate is used else, EstUnitCost for subcontract ProdStandard is used for internal operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.BrkQty08
member.summary: Price break/production break quantity, quantity at which a price break occurs for subcontracting or a production break occurs for internal operations. The quantity represents the minimum qty that is needed to obtain the corresponding price/standard established in PBCost or PBStdRate arrays. Not all 5 elements need to be entered. However they must be entered consecutively in ascending order. Quoting selects the unit cost/Standard to use by first calculating the Required Qty based on the quote quantity. Then searches the BreakQty array finding the element which is less than and closest to the required qty. If one is found then the corresponding PBCost/PBStdRate is used else, EstUnitCost for subcontract ProdStandard is used for internal operations.

member.summary: Price break/production break quantity, quantity at which a price break occurs for subcontracting or a production break occurs for internal operations. member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.PBrkCost01
member.summary: If subcontract then this is unit cost for the corresponding price break quantity. (BreakQty)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QtOprAppRow.BrkQty01
member.summary: Price break/production break quantity, quantity at which a price break occurs for subcontracting or a production break occurs for internal operations. The quantity represents the minimum qty that is needed to obtain the corresponding price/standard established in PBCost or PBStdRate arrays. Not all 5 elements need to be entered. However they must be entered consecutively in ascending order. Quoting selects the unit cost/Standard to use by first calculating the Required Qty based on the quote quantity. Then searches the BreakQty array finding the element which is less than and closest to the required qty. If one is found then the corresponding PBCost/PBStdRate is used else, EstUnitCost for subcontract ProdStandard is used for internal operations.

member.summary: An integer that uniquely identifies the Assembly record within the Quote/Line. Assigned by the system one greater than the last QuoteAsm record on file for the given quote/line.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number for this assembly. Cannot be blank. It does not have to be valid in the Part master file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.Description
member.summary: Description for the Part on the assembly record. This cannot be blank. Use Part.Description if valid Part record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.RevisionNum
member.summary: The revision number for the assembly. An optional field. Use the Part.RevisionNum as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.QtyPer
member.summary: The production Quantity required for this assembly per one of it's Parent Part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.IUM
member.summary: The unit of measure for this assembly. Use the Part.IUM as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.Direct
member.summary: Indicates if this assembly material requirement is going to be satisfied by another job (possibly in another Site), as opposed to a warehouse

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.Parent
member.summary: Sequence number of the Parent Assembly. 0 means no parent assembly (i.e. this is the final assembly). Cannot be negative like the other pointers because this one shows up in a browser.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.PriorPeer
member.summary: The sequence number of the prior assembly that is on the same level as this assembly. This is known as a PriorPeer assembly. This is automatically maintained by the maintenance programs. The logic is to find the last assembly (i.e. where the Parent is the same and the NextPeer is -1). Then NextPeer of that assembly gets updated with this assembly's sequence number and this assembly gets its PriorPeer field updated with the sequence number from that assembly which was found. -1 means that there is no prior assembly (i.e. it is the first assembly of its peers).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.NextPeer
member.summary: The sequence number of the Next Assembly on the same level as this assembly. This is known as a NextPeer assembly. Automatically maintained by the maintenance programs. The logic is to find the first assembly (i.e. where the Parent is the same and the PriorPeer is -1). Then the PriorPeer of that assembly is updated with this assembly's sequence number and then this assembly's NextPeer gets updated with the sequence number from the assembly that was found. -1 means that the assembly is the last assembly of its peers.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.Child
member.summary: Seq # of this assembly's very first subassembly. This is known as the Child assembly. Automatically maintained by the maintenance programs. The logic is to find the Parent assembly record and if its child is -1, update it with this assembly's seq #.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.DrawNum
member.summary: Optional field for Engineering Drawing Number. Defaulted from BomHead.DrawNum during methods pull functions.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.CommentText
member.summary: Editor widget for Job Assembly comments.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.BomSequence
member.summary: An internally system assigned integer which is used as part of an index to organize the QuoteAsm records into a Bill of Material fashion sequence.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.BomLevel
member.summary: An internally system assigned integer which represents the "Level of Indention" of the QuoteAsm in reference to the Bill of Material structure.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.RequiredQty
member.summary: A system maintained field. This is how many of the assemblies are required to produce ONE of the END ITEM. This is a calculated field. Calculated as the ( Parents RequiredQty X QtyPer). This field needs to be refreshed whenever a change is made to the production quantity in any of its parents or when its QtyPer. The refresh may also occur if the structure of the assemblies is changed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.Template
member.summary: Indicates if this quote assembly is considered a "Template". Template lines appear in the browse of quotes that can be copied.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.AutoRecOpr
member.summary: The operation number (Quote.OprSeq) that is marked to do the Automatic Receipt to inventory. Note: Zero = no operation is set to perform the auto receive into inventory function. This field is not directly maintainable. Instead it is set during operation maintenance by having the user mark a check box indicating "Auto Receive" which then updates this field with the operations sequence number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.FindNum
member.summary: FUTURE IMPLEMENTATION - Characters used on the parent assembly drawing to show where assembly is used.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.FinalOpr
member.summary: The sequence of the operation that is to be considered as the operation which indicates the quantity complete for the Job/Assembly. In other words this operations completed quantity = Job/Assembly completed. Note: Zero = no operation is set and that the system should use the last operation to determine quantity complete. This field is not directly maintainable. Instead it is set during operation maintenance by having the user mark a check box indicating "Final Operation" which then updates this field with the operations sequence number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.WIDueHour
member.summary: Used for scheduling. Only valid for the Date and Quantity the user entered in quote scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmRow.OrigStructTag
member.summary: When getting details on a multi-level configuration, the StructTag is used to load the configuration at each level so that method rules can be applied at that level. By storing the original StructTag of the configuration as it was defined under its parent, it speeds up the process of determining where the lower level configured was originally configured. If this field is populated, the lower level was originally configured as a child of another configured part.

member.summary: A sequence number that uniquely defines the Material record within a specific Quote/Line/Assembly. System assigned using the next available number, determined by reading last QuoteMtl record on the Quote/Line/Assembly and then adding one to it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number of required material. Does not have to be valid in Part master file, but must not be blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.Description
member.summary: Description of the material. Cannot be blank

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.QtyPer
member.summary: Quantity required per one of the Parent item. This is a factor used in calculating the total material requirement.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.IUM
member.summary: The issue/usage unit of measure for this material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.Direct
member.summary: Indicates if this material requirement is going to be satisfied by another job (possibly in another Site), as opposed to a warehouse.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.LeadTime
member.summary: Expected Purchasing lead time (in days) for the material. This is passed along to the job if the item gets manufactured.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.RelatedOperation
member.summary: A material record can be related to a specific operation. This field contains the QuoteOpr.OprSeq of the operation that it is related to. It can be left as zero meaning that this material is required at the very beginning of the production job.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.SalvagePartNum
member.summary: Part number for Salvaged scrap from this material record. An optional field. This does not have to be valid in the Part master. Salvage info is mainly to allow the credit back to a job for this type of scrap via Salvage receipt process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.SalvageDescription
member.summary: Description of Salvaged material. Use Part.Description for a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.SalvageQtyPer
member.summary: A factor that multiplied by the RequiredQty for the material results in the expected total salvage quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.SalvageUM
member.summary: Default Unit of measure for the Salvaged Part. Default from the Part.IUM.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.SalvageUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated Salvage Unit Credit. Use the appropriate cost from the Part master as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.SalvageMtlBurRate
member.summary: The salvage material burden rate for this Quote Material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.SalvageEstMtlBurUnitCredit
member.summary: Estimated salvage Mtl Burden Unit Credit. May be defaulted from the appropriate Part master cost fields. Quoting allows multiple unit costs to be entered for quantity price breaks via PBQty & PBCost arrays. The price break logic considers the EstUnitCost field as the lowest element in the price break structure. That is if you had price breaks for quantities of 100, 500 and 1000. Then the EstUnitCost would represent the cost if the required qty is 1 - 99.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.MfgComment
member.summary: Comments for manufacturing about this material record. These comments are printed on manufacturing reports, such as the router. For valid Parts use the Part.MfgComment as a default. View as Editor widget.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.VendorNum
member.summary: Used to identify a default vendor. Use the Part.VendorNum as a default. This will be used as a default for purchasing and miscellaneous receipts. This field is not directly maintainable; instead it's assigned by having the user either entering the "VendorID" and then finding the VendorNum in the Vendor file or by selection list processing. An optional field, but if entered must be valid.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.PurPoint
member.summary: The Vendors purchase point ID. Along with the VendorNum is used to tie back to the VendorPP master file. Use the default Purchase point defined in the Vendor file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.BuyIt
member.summary: Indicates if this material is to be Purchased for the Job. If this is a non inventory part then this is "Yes" and can't be changed. If this is a valid Part then set it to "NO" but the user can override it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.PurComment
member.summary:
Comments for purchasing about this material record on this job. These comments will be used as defaults to the PODetail.Comment field when the purchase order references this JobMtl record.
View as Editor widget.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.MinimumCost
member.summary: Minimum Cost that will be used for this material. That is if the system will take the greater of (required quantity * unit cost) or (MinimumCost) when calculating the material cost for the quote.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.EstUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Unit Cost. May be defaulted from the appropriate Part master cost fields. Quoting allows multiple unit costs to be entered for quantity price breaks via PBQty & PBCost arrays. The price break logic considers the EstUnitCost field as the lowest element in the price break structure. That is if you had price breaks for quantities of 100, 500 and 1000. Then the EstUnitCost would represent the cost if the required qty is 1 - 99.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.MtlBurRate
member.summary: The material burden rate for this Quote Material.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.EstMtlBurUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Mtl Burden Unit Cost. May be defaulted from the appropriate Part master cost fields. Quoting allows multiple unit costs to be entered for quantity price breaks via PBQty & PBCost arrays. The price break logic considers the EstUnitCost field as the lowest element in the price break structure. That is if you had price breaks for quantities of 100, 500 and 1000. Then the EstUnitCost would represent the cost if the required qty is 1 - 99.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.RequiredQty
member.summary: Required Qty per ONE of the END ITEM. This is a system calculated field. Calculated as (Parent Required Qty X QtyPer). The parent qty is one if assemblySeq zero else (QuoteAsmbl.RequireQty) if AssemblySeq > 0.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.EstScrap
member.summary: Estimated Scrap (fallout) that is expected to occur for this material. The scrap increase the Required quantity. Example; need 1000 pieces scrap of 10 % will show a required quantity of 1100.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.EstScrapType
member.summary: Qualifies the ScrapQty entry as being a fixed quantity or a percentage of run quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.FixedQty
member.summary: Indicates if the QtyPer field represents a "Fixed Quantity". If Yes, then the required quantity = QtyPer. That is, the quantity does not change as the number of pieces being produced changes. This can be used to enter Tooling or Fixture type of requirements.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.FindNum
member.summary: Characters used on the drawing to show where material is used.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.Class
member.summary: The Inventory class that this Part belongs to. The Class field can be blank or must be valid in the PartClass master file. CLasses could be set up for different type of raw materials. It will primarily be used as a report selection parameter.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.APSAddResType
member.summary: Advanced Planning and Scheduling Additional Resource Type. Indicates whether the Part should be treated as an AdditionalResourceType by eScheduler. 'I' to ignore in eScheduler 'M' to treat at Material in eScheduler 'A' to treat as AddResType in eScheduler

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.RFQNeeded

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.RFQVendQuotes

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.RFQNum

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.RFQLine

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.PBrkQty01
member.summary: Price break quantity, quantity at which a price break occurs. The quantity represent the minimum qty that is needed to obtain the corresponding price established in PBCost array. Not all 4 elements need to be entered. However they must be entered consecutively in ascending order. Quoting selects the material unit cost to use by first calculating the material Required Qty based on the quote quantity. Then searches the PBQty array finding the element which is less than and closest to the required qty. If one is found then the corresponding PBCost is used else EstUnitCost is used.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteMtlRow.OrigStructTag
member.summary: When getting details on a multi-level configuration, the StructTag is used to load the configuration at each level so that method rules can be applied at that level. By storing the original StructTag of the configuration as it was defined under its parent, it speeds up the process of determining where the lower level configured was originally configured. If this field is populated, the lower level was originally configured as a child of another configured part.

member.summary: The QuoteLine that record is related to.

member.summary: The AssemblySeq number of the related QuoteAsm record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.OprSeq
member.summary: A sequence number which uniquely identifies the operation record within the Quote/Line/Assembly. The sequence can be system generated or assigned by user. System generated numbers are determined by reading last QuoteOpr for the QuoteLine/Asm and then figures out what the next number that is divisible by 10. If this number is within 3 of the last Number on file it will be bumped up another 10. This keeps a minimum of 2 available sequences between records. For example if last = 18 Next would be 30, If last = 17 next = 20.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.OpCode
member.summary: Operation Master Code - Links the QuoteOpr record with a OpMaster record. Default is given from WrkCenter.OpCode. Must be valid in the OpMaster file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.OpStdID
member.summary:
The Operation standard ID. This links the JobOPer to the OpStd master file. This can be blank or if entered must be valid if entered. When this field is changed the ProdStandard, StdFormat and StdBasis should be refreshed with the new defaults.
Valid for "inside operations" only.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.EstSetHours
member.summary: The TOTAL estimated set up hours FOR ALL MACHINES. This can be zero only if the ProdStandard is greater than zero. Default from OpStd.SetupHours * Machines.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.ProdStandard
member.summary:
The production standard for the operation. It can be expressed as Hours, Minutes per piece, Pieces per Time, Operations per Minute or Operations per hour. This along with the StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPer and fields are used to calculate the operations estimated production hours. A value can be defaulted from the OpStd master.
NOTE: The ProdStandard can only be zero if the EstSetHours are greater than zero.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.StdFormat
member.summary:
Qualifier for the Production Standard field. The valid qualifiers are:
"HP" - Hours/Piece, "MP" - Minutes/Piece, "PH" - Pieces/Hour,
"PM" - Pieces/Minute, "OH" - Operations/Hour,
"OM" - Operations/Minute, HR - Fixed Hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.StdBasis
member.summary:
A standard basis is to be used to with standards that are time per piece (HP & MP). The basis is a Divisor to the number of pieces. Valid codes are E-Eaches, C=100's, M=1000's, T=10,000.
This field is used in the formula for calculating the estimated production hours. The operation quantity is divided by the basis value and then multiplied by the standard to result in hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.OpsPerPart
member.summary: Number of operations per part. This is used in the calculation of the estimated production hours when the StdFormat is "OM" or "OH". This should not be accessible if StdFormat is not "OM" or "OH". It MUST BE > 0 if StdFormat is "OM" or "OH".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.QtyPer
member.summary: Production Quantity per one of the Parent Item.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.ProdLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for estimated production labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.QProdLRate if not zero, else OpMaster.ProdLRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.SetupLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate for estimated setup labor costs. Default from the OpMaster.QSetupLRate if not zero, else OpMaster.SetupLabRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.ProdBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the production time on this operation. (EstProdHrs X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.QProdBurRate if not zero, else WrkCenter.ProdBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.SetupBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate to be used for the Setup time on this operation. (EstSetHours X ProdBurRate). Default from the WrkCenter.QSetUpBurRate if not zero, else WrkCenter.SetupBurRate.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.Machines
member.summary: Defaulted from the WrkCenter.SchMachines field. This is the number of machines that this operation will run on at the same time. Logically thought of as a "Squeeze factor" to scheduling. That is, the more machines the shorter the schedule. This affects how much of the total daily workcenter capacity that the operation will consume. For example; Center has 4 machines, 8 Hours per day and operation 2 machines. This operation would consume 16 hours of capacity per day. So if it had 32 hours of estimated production it would schedule as taking 2 days. NOTE THIS ONLY APPLIES TO PRODUCTION HOURS, NOT SETUP. The stored setup hours is a total for all machines. This stored number is divided by the number of machines when it is displayed on the screen during operation maintenance.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.SetUpCrewSize
member.summary: Defaulted from the WrkCenter.SetUpCrewSize field. It's the number of people it physically takes to set up this operation. It is used as a multiplier in the estimated labor hours calculation. JobOper.EstSetHours * JobOper.SetUpCrewSize = Estimated Labor hours for the operation. This also affects the estimated labor cost. Est Cost = Est Labor Hours * SetUpLaborRate

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.ProdCrewSize
member.summary: Defaults from the WrkCenter.ProdCrewSize. The number of people it physically takes to perform the production on this operation per machine that it is run on. CrewSize * JobOper.EstProdHours = Est. Prod. Labor Hours. Note this can be a fraction for operations that do not require full time attention of an employee. See also SetUpCrewSize.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.EstScrap
member.summary: Estimated Scrap (fallout) that is expected to occur on this operation. The scrap increase the Run quantity. Example; need 1000 pieces scrap of 10 % will show a operation run quantity of 1100.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.EstScrapType
member.summary: Qualifies the ScrapQty entry as being a fixed quantity or a percentage of run quantity.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.SubContract
member.summary: This flags the operation as being a "SubContract" or an "Internal" operation. This also controls what fields are allowed to be updated for this record. For example, an internal operation will not have a PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.IUM
member.summary: Issue Unit of Measure. Applicable only when SubContract = Yes

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.DaysOut
member.summary: Hours required is calculated as days * 8. Only Applicable when SubContract = Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.PartNum
member.summary: The PartNum to be shipped to the subcontract. Applicable only when SubContract = Yes. Default the QuoteDtl.PartNum or QuoteAsm.PartNum depending on the QuoteOpr.AssemblySeq.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.Description
member.summary: Description of item to be sent to subcontractor.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.VendorNum
member.summary: The SubContractors VendorNum that ties back to the Vendor master file. This is only valid for "SubContract" operations. This field is not directly maintainable, instead its assigned by having the user either enter the "VendorID" and then finding the VendorNum in the Vendor file or by selection list processing. This is a mandatory entry for subcontract operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.PurPoint
member.summary: The Vendors purchase point ID. This field is only for the "Subcontract" operations. Along with the VendorNum is used to tie back to the VendorPP master file. Use the default Purchase point defined in the Vendor file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.CommentText
member.summary: Editor widget for quote operation comments.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.SchedRelation
member.summary: Indicates the scheduling relationship between this and the preceding operation. Possible values are "SS" - Start to Start, "FS" Finish to Start or "FF" Finish to Finish. A "SS" can start when the preceding operation starts. A "FS" starts when the preceding operation is finished. A "FF" can finish when the preceding operation finishes. These relationships do not span between levels of assemblies. The first operation on an assembly is always treated as being "FS" relationship. A "FF" finishes when the preceding operation is finished.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.MinimumCost
member.summary: Minimum Cost that will be used for subcontract costs. That is if the system will take the greater of (required quantity * unit cost) or (MinimumCost) when calculating the subcontract cost for the quote.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.EstUnitCost
member.summary: Estimated Unit Cost. May be defaulted from the appropriate Part master cost fields. Quoting allows multiple unit costs to be entered for quantity price breaks via PBQty & PBCost arrays. The price break logic considers the EstUnitCost field as the lowest element in the price break structure. That is if you had price breaks for quantities of 100, 500 and 1000. Then the EstUnitCost would represent the cost if the required qty is 1 - 99.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.AddlSetupHours
member.summary: Additional Setup Hours that will be required after a certain quantity has been run for this operation. The quantity at which this occurs is established in AddSetupQty field. The system determines the setup hours as SetupHrs + (Max((RunQty - AddlSetupQty,0))/AddlSetUpQty) * AddlSetupHours. Any fractional results of the AddlSetUpQty calcs are rounded up to the next whole number before multiplying by the AddlSetUpHours..

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.AddlSetUpQty
member.summary: Additional Setup quantity indicates the quantity at which additional setup time will be incurred.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.RunQty
member.summary: The total operation quantity per ONE of the End Part. This is a system calculated field. Calculated as (Assembly Required Qty X QtyPer). This does not include scrap quantity. The scrap will be determined as each quoting quantity is applied towards the operation during the cost calculations. The assembly qty is either the One if QuoteOpr.AssemblySeq = 0 or (QuoteAsm.RequireQty) if QuoteOpr.AssemblySeq > 0. This value is refreshed when maintenance is performed on the operation record or an assemblies production qty is changed

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.MiscAmt
member.summary: A total additional charge that is incurred when purchasing this service. Ex(Lot,Setup,Handling,etc...). Defaulted from VendPart.MiscAmt. This is NOT part of the a Unit Cost. It is NOT consider in the logic of using Minimum Cost.

member.summary: A flag to indicate that this quote operation requires an RFQ. If it does require an RFQ, the user must enter the number of vendor quotes that are required. This only applies to subcontract operations.

member.summary: Indicates the Method for Labor Entry. Can be "T" - Time and Quantity, "Q" - Quantity Only (Time is estimated) or "B" - Backflush.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.RFQLine

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.RFQStat
member.summary: RFQ Status. W= Waiting, A = Accepted, R = Requested, C = Received

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.SetupGroup
member.summary: Used to group operation to save on setups.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.PrimarySetupOpDtl
member.summary: Identifies the primary QuoteOpDtl to be used for setup. The setup time for the operation is determined on the QuoteOpDtl. If <> 0, must identify a valid QuoteOpDtl. The QuoteOpDtl needs to have a RequiredFor = S or B.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.PrimaryProdOpDtl
member.summary: Identifies the primary QuoteOpDtl to be used for production. The production run time for the operation is determined on the QuoteOpDtl. If <> 0, must identify a valid QuoteOpDtl. The QuoteOpDtl needs to have a RequiredFor = P or B.

member.summary: Operation Description.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.GlbRFQ
member.summary: Global RFQ flag. Used in Consolidated Purchasing.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.BrkQty07
member.summary: Price break/production break quantity, quantity at which a price break occurs for subcontracting or a production break occurs for internal operations. The quantity represents the minimum qty that is needed to obtain the corresponding price/standard established in PBCost or PBStdRate arrays. Not all 5 elements need to be entered. However they must be entered consecutively in ascending order. Quoting selects the unit cost/Standard to use by first calculating the Required Qty based on the quote quantity. Then searches the BreakQty array finding the element which is less than and closest to the required qty. If one is found then the corresponding PBCost/PBStdRate is used else, EstUnitCost for subcontract ProdStandard is used for internal operations.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.SNRequiredOpr
member.summary: Indicates whether serial numbers are required form this operation. When true the system will prompt in labor entry processes for the serial numbers that have been completed on this operation.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.SendAheadType
member.summary:
Determines the scheduling offset for the secondary start-to-start operation, offset which will be either
calculated (or entered) on the primary operation. The offset time can be calculated by pieces, percentage
of the operation duration or entered manually by the user on the primary operation. The secondary operation
will scheduled to start after the offset period.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprRow.SendAheadOffset
member.summary:
Scheduling offset for the secondary start-to-start operation. The offset time can be calculated by pieces,
percentage of the operation duration or entered manually by the user on the primary operation. The
secondary operation will scheduled to start after the offset period.

member.summary: The AssemblySeq number of the related QuoteAsm record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprInspRow.OprSeq
member.summary: A sequence number which uniquely identifies the operation record within the Quote/Line/Assembly. The sequence can be system generated or assigned by user. System generated numbers are determined by reading last QuoteOpr for the QuoteLine/Asm and then figures out what the next number that is divisible by 10. If this number is within 3 of the last Number on file it will be bumped up another 10. This keeps a minimum of 2 available sequences between records. For example if last = 18 Next would be 30, If last = 17 next = 20.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOprInspRow.PlanSeq
member.summary: A sequence number that uniquely identifies the QuoteOprInsp record within the QuoteNum/QuoteLine/AssemblySeq/OprSeq

member.summary: The inspection plan part number (configurator part number).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.CapabilityID
member.summary: The user can select the capability the operation is to perform. The system will select the resource.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.ResourceGrpID
member.summary: The user can select a Resource Group for the operation to be performed on. The system will select the actual resource.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.ResourceID
member.summary: Descriptive code assigned by the user to uniquely identify the Resource for this operation to be performed on.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.SetupHours
member.summary: The standard setup hours for the operation. This is the setup time required for each machine.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.ProdHours
member.summary: Production hours for this operation. It is the total hours, as though the operation were running on a single machine.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.NumResources
member.summary: This is the number of resources the operation can run on. If multiple resources can perform the required Capability, then up to this many will be employed. This determines the number of setups the system will allow for the operation. However, the number of setups cannot exceed the number of operations. The idea being that once a part is on a machine you will complete the operation on that resource.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.SetupBurRate
member.summary: The burden rate used for setup time. Used as a default in Job and Quote entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.ProdBurRate
member.summary: Burden rate used for production time on an operation. Job and Quoting use it as a default when entering operation details.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.SetupLabRate
member.summary: The labor rate used for setup time. Used as a default in Job and Quote entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.ProdLabRate
member.summary: Labor rate used for production time on an operation. Job and Quoting use it as a default when entering operation details.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.SetupOrProd
member.summary: Identifies which part of the production, setup or production, the resource is required for. Valid values are "S", indicating the resource is RequiredFor the Setup phase of this operation, "P" for Production phase, or "B" meaning Both setup and production phase.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.OpDtlDesc
member.summary: Description is initially created when the QuoteOpDtl is created. If the QuoteOpDtl is created from a Resource it will be the Resource.Description, if it's created from an ResourceGroup it will be the ResourceGroup.Description. Once set it is not changed by the system.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.ProdStandard
member.summary: The production standard for the operation. It can be expressed as Hours, Minutes per piece, Pieces per Time, Operations per Minute or Operations per hour. This along with the StdFormat, StdBasis, OpsPer and fields are used to calculate the operations estimated production hours. A value can be defaulted from the OpStd master. NOTE: The ProdStandard can only be zero if the EstSetHours are greater than zero.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.StdFormat
member.summary: Qualifier for the Production Standard field. This is used as a default to the qualifier field in operation details. The valid qualifiers are; "HP" - Hours/Piece, "MP" - minutes/piece, "PH" - pieces/hour, "PM" - Pieces/Minute, "OH" - Operations/Hour, "OM" - Operations/minute, HR - Fixed Hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.StdBasis
member.summary: A standard basis is to be used to with standards that are time per piece (HP & MP). The basis is a Divisor. Valid codes are E-Eaches, C=100's, M=1000's, T=10,000. This field is used in the formula for calculating the estimated production hours. The operation quantity is divided by the basis value and then multiplied by the standard to result in hours.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.OpsPerPart
member.summary: Number of operations per part. This is used in the calculation of the estimated production hours when the StdFormat is "OM" or "OH". This should not be accessible if StdFormat is not "OM" or "OH". It MUST BE > 0 if StdFormat is "OM" or "OH".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.OverrideRates
member.summary: If yes then the user has overridden the rates that were on the record when it was inititally created. The initial rates came from the master files.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.ConcurrentCapacity
member.summary: Concurrent Capacity is a constraint that prevents a Resource from being overloaded because it has, at a given time, this much capacity. For example, a Resource has 4 racks, and they can be reused, but once they've been selected for an operation, they're tied up until the operation is complete.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.DailyProdRate
member.summary: The Daily Prod rate contains the rate required to make 1. This is multiplied with the mfg qty of the job to get the total production qty. This total is then compared to the resource's daily production quantity and with any usage stored in the Shopload record. Once the production limit for a resource has been reached, the Resource has been consumed for that day.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.SetUpCrewSize
member.summary: Duplicated from QuoteOper.SetupCrewSize. It's the number of people it physically takes to set up this operation. It is used as a multiplier in the estimated labor hours calculation. JobOper.EstSetHours * JobOper.SetUpCrewSize = Estimated Labor hours for the operation. This also affects the estimated labor cost. Est Cost = Est Labor Hours * SetUpLaborRate

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteOpDtlRow.ProdCrewSize
member.summary: Duplicated from QuoteOper.ProdCrewSize. The number of people it physically takes to perform the production on this operation per machine that it is run on. CrewSize * JobOper.EstProdHours = Est. Prod. Labor Hours. Note this can be a fraction for operations that do not require full time attention of an employee. See also SetUpCrewSize.

member.summary: Revision identifier for this row. It is incremented upon each write.

member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.QuoteNum
member.summary: Quote number to which this line item detail record is associated with. This is part of the foreign key to OrderHed file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.QuoteLine
member.summary: This field along with Company and QuoteNum make up the unique key to the table. The system generates this number during entry of new detail records. The system determines next available number by finding the last QuoteDtl record for the Quote and the adding 1 to it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.AssemblySeq
member.summary: An integer that uniquely identifies the Assembly record within the Quote/Line. Assigned by the system one greater than the last QuoteAsm record on file for the given quote/line.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number for this assembly. Cannot be blank. It does not have to be valid in the Part master file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.Description
member.summary: Description for the Part on the assembly record. This cannot be blank. Use Part.Description if valid Part record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.RevisionNum
member.summary: The revision number for the assembly. An optional field. Use the Part.RevisionNum as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.QtyPer
member.summary: The production Quantity required for this assembly per one of it's Parent Part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.IUM
member.summary: The unit of measure for this assembly. Use the Part.IUM as a default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.Direct
member.summary: Indicates if this assembly material requirement is going to be satisfied by another job (possibly in another Site), as opposed to a warehouse

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.Parent
member.summary: Sequence number of the Parent Assembly. 0 means no parent assembly (i.e. this is the final assembly). Cannot be negative like the other pointers because this one shows up in a browser.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.PriorPeer
member.summary: The sequence number of the prior assembly that is on the same level as this assembly. This is known as a PriorPeer assembly. This is automatically maintained by the maintenance programs. The logic is to find the last assembly (i.e. where the Parent is the same and the NextPeer is -1). Then NextPeer of that assembly gets updated with this assembly's sequence number and this assembly gets its PriorPeer field updated with the sequence number from that assembly which was found. -1 means that there is no prior assembly (i.e. it is the first assembly of its peers).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.NextPeer
member.summary: The sequence number of the Next Assembly on the same level as this assembly. This is known as a NextPeer assembly. Automatically maintained by the maintenance programs. The logic is to find the first assembly (i.e. where the Parent is the same and the PriorPeer is -1). Then the PriorPeer of that assembly is updated with this assembly's sequence number and then this assembly's NextPeer gets updated with the sequence number from the assembly that was found. -1 means that the assembly is the last assembly of its peers.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.Child
member.summary: Seq # of this assembly's very first subassembly. This is known as the Child assembly. Automatically maintained by the maintenance programs. The logic is to find the Parent assembly record and if its child is -1, update it with this assembly's seq #.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.DrawNum
member.summary: Optional field for Engineering Drawing Number. Defaulted from BomHead.DrawNum during methods pull functions.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.CommentText
member.summary: Editor widget for Job Assembly comments.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.BomSequence
member.summary: An internally system assigned integer which is used as part of an index to organize the QuoteAsm records into a Bill of Material fashion sequence.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.BomLevel
member.summary: An internally system assigned integer which represents the "Level of Indention" of the QuoteAsm in reference to the Bill of Material structure.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.RequiredQty
member.summary: A system maintained field. This is how many of the assemblies are required to produce ONE of the END ITEM. This is a calculated field. Calculated as the ( Parents RequiredQty X QtyPer). This field needs to be refreshed whenever a change is made to the production quantity in any of its parents or when its QtyPer. The refresh may also occur if the structure of the assemblies is changed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.Template
member.summary: Indicates if this quote assembly is considered a "Template". Template lines appear in the browse of quotes that can be copied.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.AutoRecOpr
member.summary: The operation number (Quote.OprSeq) that is marked to do the Automatic Receipt to inventory. Note: Zero = no operation is set to perform the auto receive into inventory function. This field is not directly maintainable. Instead it is set during operation maintenance by having the user mark a check box indicating "Auto Receive" which then updates this field with the operations sequence number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.FindNum
member.summary: FUTURE IMPLEMENTATION - Characters used on the parent assembly drawing to show where assembly is used.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.FinalOpr
member.summary: The sequence of the operation that is to be considered as the operation which indicates the quantity complete for the Job/Assembly. In other words this operations completed quantity = Job/Assembly completed. Note: Zero = no operation is set and that the system should use the last operation to determine quantity complete. This field is not directly maintainable. Instead it is set during operation maintenance by having the user mark a check box indicating "Final Operation" which then updates this field with the operations sequence number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.WIStartDate
member.summary: Used for scheduling a quote. This date is only valid for the quantity and date the user entered for Quote Scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.WIStartHour
member.summary: This field is established by scheduling, and it only valid for the Date/Quantity the user entered in quote scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.WIDueDate
member.summary: Used for scheduling. Only valid for the Date and Quantity the user entered in quote scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.WIDueHour
member.summary: Used for scheduling. Only valid for the Date and Quantity the user entered in quote scheduling.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.RelatedOperation
member.summary: An assembly record can be related to a specific operation. This field contains the QuoteOper.OprSeq of the operation that it is related to. It can be left as zero meaning that this assembly is required at the very beginning of the production job. The related operation is also used to calculate scheduled start date.

member.summary: The prefix will be defaulted from the reference category defined for the assemblies. The value on this field will be used to create reference designators.

member.summary: The suffix will be defaulted from the reference category defined for the assemblie. The value on this field will be used to create reference designators.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.AnalysisCdDescription
member.summary: Description

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.PartNumPricePerCode
member.summary: Indicates the pricing per quantity for this part. It can be "E" = per each, "C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Maintainable only via Part Maintenance. The initial default is "E". Used as default PricePerCode in order entry and invoice entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.PartNumTrackDimension
member.summary: Onhand quantity is always tracked in the Parts primary inventory uom (Part.IUM). Checking this box indicates that you want to allow tracking of onhand quantity by additional uoms. The actual UOMs to be tracked for the part are indicated by PartUOM.TrackOnHand. In order to set the PartUOM.TrackOhHand = True the Part.TrackDimension must = true. This replaces the old 8.3 Track Dimension feature

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.PartNumIUM
member.summary: Primary Inventory Unit of Measure. The unit costs, are based on this uom. Used as a default for issue transactions for the part. Part onhand and allocation quantities are tracked by this uom. The quantities can also be tracked by other uoms (see PartUOM table) but tracking at this uom is mandatory. Use UOMClass.DefUOMCode of the system default UOMClass when creating new part records (see XASyst.DefUOMClassID).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.PartNumSalesUM
member.summary: The Selling Unit of measure for the Part. The UOM which the unit prices are based on. Defaults as the Part.IUM.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.PartNumTrackLots
member.summary: Indicates if Lot numbers are prompted for in transactions for this part. Backflushing and AutoReceiving functions are ignored when TrackLots = Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.PartNumPartDescription
member.summary: Describes the Part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.PartNumSellingFactor
member.summary:
This value is used to convert quantity when there is a difference in the customers unit of measure and how it is stocked in inventory. Example is sold in pounds, stocked in sheets.
Formula: Inventory Qty * Conversion Factor = Selling Qty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.QuoteAsmListRow.PartNumTrackSerialNum
member.summary: Indicates if this part is serial number tracked
